dictionary.title: https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Virus_topics&action=edit

entry.name: ‎meropenem‎
entry.description: chemical compound

entry.name: ‎Antigenic drift‎
entry.description: mechanism for variation in viruses

entry.name: ‎antiviral drug‎
entry.description: Class of medications

entry.name: ‎bacteriophage‎
entry.description: virus that infects and replicates within bacteria

entry.name: ‎capsid‎
entry.description: protein coat that surrounds the infective nucleic acid in some virus particles. It comprises numerous regularly arranged subunits, or capsomeres.

entry.name: ‎Wikimedia category‎
entry.description: use with 'instance of' (P31) for Wikimedia category

entry.name: ‎Common‎
entry.description: American rapper, actor and author from Illinois

entry.name: ‎giant virus‎
entry.description: giant nucleocytoplasmic large DNA viruses that have extremely large genomes compared to other viruses and contain many unique genes not found in other life forms

entry.name: ‎history‎
entry.description: past events and their record

entry.name: ‎introduction‎
entry.description: beginning section which states the purpose and goals of the following writing

entry.name: ‎laboratory diagnosis of viral infections‎
entry.description: laboratory methods for determining whether a virus infection has occurred in an organism

entry.name: ‎microbiology‎
entry.description: study of microscopic organisms

entry.name: ‎neurotropic virus‎
entry.description: virus that is capable of infecting nerve cells

entry.name: ‎oncovirus‎
entry.description: viruses that can cause cancer

entry.name: ‎Plant Foods for Human Nutrition‎
entry.description: peer-reviewed scientific journal

entry.name: ‎plant virus‎
entry.description: virus that affects plants

entry.name: ‎Wikimedia portal‎
entry.description: pages on a Wikimedia wiki intended to serve as "Main Pages" for specific areas of knowledge or information, or for specific audiences and activities. Use with P31 'instance of' for them

entry.name: ‎Reassortment‎
entry.description: mixing of the genetic material

entry.name: ‎communications satellite‎
entry.description: artificial satellite designed for telecommunications

entry.name: ‎viral infectious disease‎
entry.description: Human, animal or plant disease resulting from a viral infection

entry.name: ‎viral entry‎
entry.description: biological process

entry.name: ‎viral envelope‎
entry.description: lipid bilayer of a virion that surrounds the protein capsid, and may also contain glycoproteins

entry.name: ‎viral life cycle‎
entry.description: A set of processes which all viruses follow to ensure survival; includes attachment and entry of the virus particle, decoding of genome information, translation of viral mRNA by host ribosomes, genome replication, and assembly and release of viral pa

entry.name: ‎viral load‎
entry.description: amount of virus found in host tissue

entry.name: ‎viral protein‎
entry.description: proteins found in any species of virus

entry.name: ‎viral replication‎
entry.description: formation of biological viruses during the infection process in the target host cells

entry.name: ‎viral shedding‎
entry.description: dissemination of mature viral particles from the host cell

entry.name: ‎Viroplasm‎
entry.description: cellular compartment in which viruses replicate

entry.name: ‎virus‎
entry.description: type of non-cellular infectious pathogen that replicates only inside the living cells of an organism

entry.name: ‎virus-like particle‎
entry.description: virion that lacks nucleic acid

entry.name: ‎virus classification‎
entry.description: organisation of viruses into a taxonomic system

entry.name: ‎Virus latency‎
entry.description: Ability of some viruses to lie dormant within a cell

entry.name: ‎virus quantification‎
entry.description: microbiological method regarding viruses

entry.name: ‎WikiProject‎
entry.description: working groups on Wikimedia projects
